00124 #define arg_PUTFH4 op->nfs_argop4_u.opputfh  
00125 #define res_PUTFH4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.opputfh 
00126 
00144 int nfs4_op_putfh(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
00145                     compound_data_t   * data,
00146                     struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
00147 {
00148   int                i ;
00149   int                rc ;
00150   int                error  ;
00151   fsal_attrib_list_t attr ;
00152   char               outstr[1024] ;
00153   char               funcname[] = "nfs4_op_putfh" ;
00154 
00155 
00156   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_PUTFH ;
00157   res_PUTFH4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00158 
00159   /* If there is no FH */
00160   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Empty( &(arg_PUTFH4.object) ) )
00161     {
00162       res_PUTFH4.status = NFS4ERR_NOFILEHANDLE ;
00163       return res_PUTFH4.status ;
00164     }
00165   
00166   /* If the filehandle is invalid */
00167   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Invalid( &(arg_PUTFH4.object) ) )
00168     {
00169       res_PUTFH4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
00170       return res_PUTFH4.status ;
00171     }
00172   
00173   /* Tests if teh Filehandle is expired (for volatile filehandle) */
00174   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Expired( &(arg_PUTFH4.object) ) )
00175     {
00176       res_PUTFH4.status = NFS4ERR_FHEXPIRED ;
00177       return res_PUTFH4.status ;
00178     }
00179   
00180   /* If no currentFH were set, allocate one */
00181   if( data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len == 0 )
00182     {
00183       if( ( error = nfs4_AllocateFH( &(data->currentFH) ) ) != NFS4_OK )
00184         {
00185           res_PUTFH4.status = error ;
00186           return res_PUTFH4.status ;
00187         }
00188     }
00189 
00190   /* The same is to be done with mounted_on_FH */
00191   if( data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_len == 0 )
00192     {
00193       if( ( error = nfs4_AllocateFH( &(data->mounted_on_FH) ) ) != NFS4_OK )
00194         {
00195           res_PUTFH4.status = error ;
00196           return res_PUTFH4.status ;
00197         }
00198     }
00199 
00200   
00201   /* Copy the filehandle from the reply structure */
00202   data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len = arg_PUTFH4.object.nfs_fh4_len ;
00203   data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_len = arg_PUTFH4.object.nfs_fh4_len ;
00204 
00205   /* Put the data in place */
00206   memcpy( data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_val,     arg_PUTFH4.object.nfs_fh4_val, arg_PUTFH4.object.nfs_fh4_len ) ;
00207   memcpy( data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_val, arg_PUTFH4.object.nfs_fh4_val, arg_PUTFH4.object.nfs_fh4_len ) ;
00208 
00209 
00210 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
00211   nfs4_sprint_fhandle( &arg_PUTFH4.object, outstr ) ;
00212   DisplayLog( "NFS4_OP_PUTFH CURRENTFH BEFORE: File handle = %s", outstr );
00213 #endif
00214   /* If the filehandle is not pseudo hs file handle, get the entry related to it, otherwise use fake values */
00215   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Pseudo( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00216     {
00217       data->current_entry = NULL ;
00218       data->current_filetype = DIR_BEGINNING ;
00219       data->pexport = NULL ; /* No exportlist is related to pseudo fs */
00220     }
00221   else
00222     { 
00223       /* If data->exportp is null, a junction from pseudo fs was traversed, credp and exportp have to be updated */
00224       if( data->pexport == NULL )
00225         {
00226           if( ( error = nfs4_SetCompoundExport( data ) ) != NFS4_OK )
00227             {
00228               res_PUTFH4.status = error ;
00229               return res_PUTFH4.status ;
00230             }
00231         }
00232       
00233       /* Build the pentry */
00234       if( ( data->current_entry = nfs_FhandleToCache( NFS_V4, 
00235                                                       NULL, 
00236                                                       NULL, 
00237                                                       &(data->currentFH),
00238                                                       NULL,
00239                                                       NULL,
00240                                                       &(res_PUTFH4.status),
00241                                                       &attr,
00242                                                       data->pcontext, 
00243                                                       data->pclient,
00244                                                       data->ht, 
00245                                                       &rc ) ) == NULL )
00246       {
00247           res_PUTFH4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
00248           return res_PUTFH4.status ;
00249         }
00250 
00251       /* Extract the filetype */
00252       data->current_filetype = cache_inode_fsal_type_convert( attr.type ) ; 
00253       
00254     }
00255   
00256   /* Trace */
00257 
00258   return NFS4_OK ;
00259 } /* nfs4_op_putfh */
00260 
00261 
00272 void nfs4_op_putfh_Free( PUTFH4res * resp )
00273 {
00274   /* Nothing to be freed */
00275   return ;
00276 } /* nfs4_op_create_Free */
